com.clrs.sorting

Class QuickSort

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.clrs.sorting.QuickSort

  • public class QuickSort
extends Object
    Sorts arrays via Quick sort, for more details about Quick sort see Quick Sort Wiki
    See Also:
    InsertionSort, MergeSort, HeapSort, BubbleSort

    • Method Detail

      • sort

        public static void sort(int[] array)
        Sorts an int[] in ascending order using quick sort.

        This method sorts the array in-place.

        Parameters:
        array - takes an integer array as input.

      • quicksort

        private static void quicksort(int[] array,
             int low,
             int high)
        Divides the arrays into smaller parts while placing one element at its true sorted position in the array.

        The recursion tree can grow quite long for large input and this might cause StackOverflowError errors.

        Parameters:
        array - the array to be sorted.
        low - the first index of the subarray.
        high - the last index of the subarray.
        Throws:
        StackOverflowError
        See Also:
        StackOverflowError

      • partition

        private static int partition(int[] array,
            int low,
            int high)
        Partitions the elements into two ideally equal parts while placing one element at its correct position relative to the sorted array.

        The index at that element must not participate in any further recursion levels.

        Parameters:
        array - the array to be sorted.
        low - the first index of the subarray.
        high - the last index of the subarray.
        Returns:
        the index of the element which got placed in its final position.

      • swap

        private static void swap(int[] array,
        int i,
        int j)
